subject: Fix error when downloading image status is not active

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

We can instead check if the image is 'Active' and then allow downloads.AFAIK, that's the only state where download should be allowed.

Darja, first, I think I must fix the typo with 'contex' - thanks Abhishek to pointed this out.

Then, I want to see a bunch of unit tests here, that check all the statuses with context, not only 'active'. It will prevent possible failures in future development.

I'm a little concerned about this change.

It changes the documented API:

 http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-image-v2.html

 "If no image data exists, the call returns the HTTP 204 status code. "

I'm also not convinced that it fixes bug 1472449.

The client doesn't handle a 403 response and actually stack traces (you can see this if you run with --debug):

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/mnt/sam/git/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/shell.py", line 605, in main
    args.func(client, args)
  File "/mnt/sam/git/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/v2/shell.py", line 278, in do_image_download
    body = gc.images.data(args.id)
  File "/mnt/sam/git/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/v2/images.py", line 194, in data
    resp, body = self.http_client.get(url)
  File "/mnt/sam/git/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/common/http.py", line 285, in get
    return self._request('GET', url, **kwargs)
  File "/mnt/sam/git/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/common/http.py", line 277, in _request
    resp, body_iter = self._handle_response(resp)
  File "/mnt/sam/git/python-glanceclient/glanceclient/common/http.py", line 93, in _handle_response
    raise exc.from_response(resp, resp.content)
HTTPForbidden: 403 Forbidden: The requested image is in status queued. Image data download is forbidden. (HTTP 403)
403 Forbidden: The requested image is in status queued. Image data download is forbidden. (HTTP 403)

Any other code written against the API will still expect the documented 204.

Also, on line 215 we can still return a 204 (no content) to the client:

raise webob.exc.HTTPNoContent(explanation=e.msg)

so the exact condition in bug 1472449 can still happen (it's just less likely).

I'm wondering if we should:

1) revert this change
2) work on this client side fix https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199549 -- with the addition of correctly handling 200/204/403/other responses.
